title: Kids
creator_credit: Miramax, Shining Excalibur Films, Independent Pictures, Killer Films, Kim Marie Druce, Harmony Korine, Larry Clark, Cary Woods and Kevin Thompson
brief_description: A controversial portrayal of teens in New York City which exposes a deeply disturbing world of sex and substance abuse.

constellations_other.name: Skate or die
constellations_other.description: Skateboarding is a subculture frequently documented, from amateur skate videos filmed with fish-eye lenses, to documentaries exploring the genesis of the subculture and gritty feature films depicting underlying social dynamics.

creator_credit_for_label: Miramax, Shining Excalibur Films, Independent Pictures, Killer Films, Kim Marie Druce, Harmony Korine, Larry Clark, Cary Woods and Kevin Thompson
description: A controversial portrayal of teens in New York City which exposes a deeply disturbing world of sex and substance abuse. The film focuses on a sexually reckless, freckle-faced boy named Telly, whose goal is to have sex with as many different girls as he can. When Jenny, a girl who has had sex only once, tests positive for HIV, she knows she contracted the disease from Telly. When Jenny discovers that Telly’s idea of “safe sex” is to only have sex with virgins, and is continuing to pass the disease onto other unsuspecting girls, Jenny makes it her business to try to stop him.
